abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the project is
            satisfactory. The project generated momentum, and most of
            the reconstruction program was timely completed.
            Additionally, economic activities and delivery of services,
            were restored, and public awareness of disaster preparedness
            has deepened. The lessons learned provide valuable insights
            for emergency lending operations, as follows: 1) Future
            emergency lending operations need to address an adequate
            balance, between the actual emergency needs, and the desire
            to attain mitigation measures for future emergencies.
            Similarly, the ability of a participatory management, with
            ad hoc resources to mobilize, as well as local
            participation, should not be compared to the management
            ability of the central Government, which is a permanent
            structure. 2) The General Reconstruction Guidelines for
            earthquake reconstruction should be considered a living
            document, updated frequently, and, featuring the latest
            applied earth science, essential for disaster preparedness.
            3) An innovative outcome of the project, suggests the use of
            bamboo for construction of seismic resistant structures;
            preliminary studies suggest its economic feasibility is
            worth researching. 4) Based on the project's
            experience, efficiency and sustainability wise, the Bank may
            wish to design appropriate responses for improving
            contracting industries' performance.
